com.example.as1.utils

Class LruBitmapCache

  • java.lang.Object
    • <any>
      • com.example.as1.utils.LruBitmapCache
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.android.volley.toolbox.ImageLoader.ImageCache

    public class LruBitmapCache
extends <any>
implements com.android.volley.toolbox.ImageLoader.ImageCache
    The LruBitmapCache class is a cache for storing Bitmap images in memory using LRU (Least Recently Used) algorithm.

    • Method Detail

      • getDefaultLruCacheSize

        public static int getDefaultLruCacheSize()
        This function returns the default size of an LRU cache based on the maximum memory available to the Java runtime environment.
        Returns:
        The method is returning an integer value which represents the default size of an LRU (Least Recently Used) cache. This size is calculated based on the maximum memory available to the application at runtime, and is set to be one eighth of that value. // This is a constructor for the LruBitmapCache class that calls another constructor with a default // cache size obtained from the `getDefaultLruCacheSize()` method. It allows the creation of a new // instance of the LruBitmapCache class with a default cache size.

      • sizeOf

        protected int sizeOf(java.lang.String key,
                     Bitmap value)
        This function calculates the size of a Bitmap object in kilobytes based on its row bytes and height.
        Parameters:
        key - The key is a unique identifier for the Bitmap object in the cache. It is usually a String that represents the URL or file path of the image.
        value - The "value" parameter in this method refers to a Bitmap object, which is an image that has been loaded into memory. The method calculates the size of this Bitmap object in kilobytes (KB) by multiplying the number of bytes per row by the height of the image and then dividing by
        Returns:
        The method `sizeOf` is returning the size of the input `Bitmap` object in kilobytes (KB). It calculates the size by multiplying the number of bytes per row of the bitmap with its height and then dividing the result by 1024 to convert it to KB.

      • getBitmap

        public Bitmap getBitmap(java.lang.String url)
        This function returns a Bitmap object for a given URL.
        Specified by:
        getBitmap in interface com.android.volley.toolbox.ImageLoader.ImageCache
        Parameters:
        url - The URL of the image that needs to be fetched as a Bitmap.
        Returns:
        A Bitmap object is being returned.

      • putBitmap

        public void putBitmap(java.lang.String url,
                      Bitmap bitmap)
        This function puts a bitmap into a cache with a specified URL key.
        Specified by:
        putBitmap in interface com.android.volley.toolbox.ImageLoader.ImageCache
        Parameters:
        url - A string representing the URL of the image to be cached.
        bitmap - A Bitmap is a representation of an image in Android. It is a type of object that contains the pixel data of an image and can be used to display the image on the screen or manipulate it in various ways. In the given code, the bitmap parameter is the image that needs to be stored in
